title.label: One of the best out there!

content.label: I love this game! It‚Äôs going on 3 years now and it‚Äôs not getting old. Gameplay is fluid and challenging with a nice ramp up. When you get towards the later levels you really feel like you earned it. Also the sayings of Sherpak are not to be missed!

title.label: At first I thought this was like weird Arkanoid

content.label: This game is so fun. This company needs to make more games. Like a lot more. The gameplay and art of their games makes for perhaps the funnest game on the iPad ‚ÄúThe executive ‚Äú on par with FTL and ‚Äúout there‚Äù and Hoplite etc.
It‚Äôs tough, but fun and different.  I like.
An absolute steal for the price. Unreal that this isn‚Äôt advertised more.
Just got this game yesterday but it is fun

title.label: Good modern interpretation of a classic model

content.label: Fun gameplay, interesting theme, generally well executed. This is a good standby. Not brilliant, but in a market full of cheap trash and exploitive revenue models, the simple quality here stands out.

title.label: A classic you dummies never bought

content.label: Title

The game is great, I definitely recommend it.
I would like more updates though.
More customization options would be cool.  Would like to be able to hide the projected path.

title.label: A great twist of a familiar genre

content.label: Wonderful game that makes it exciting to fire up and play! My only complaint is that it doesn‚Äôt have iPhone X screen support. Please add!!

I really enjoy the game and it‚Äôs quite addictive, but two complaints, first they need more levels and paddles, so hopefully they‚Äôre working on that, but lately the paddles have been sticking. I‚Äôm clearly moving to block the ball, but then It just sticks in one spot and you lose that ball (which often is the big number ball), super frustrating. Please fix this!!
I changed it because thy actually listened to people about the level progression. Still think the levels should be selectable after you‚Äôve beaten them but that‚Äôs just me.
You missed 2 stars bc you didn't allow us to save! Update this or I'm not gonn give you a 5 star :/ I'm not kidding fix this now
Great game in remembrances of brick breaker
Interesting game, understandable mechanics, quirky nature.

name.label: I'm not sayin' I'm just sayin'

content.label: Such a huge fan of this game! Gorgeous graphics, seamless gameplay, wonderful sound design, and creative story.
Pretty good so far, very nice artwork and music. I like that it's something different,
This game is so much fun. Countless hours of focused gameplay.
Basic and simple, but tweaks pong in subtle and genius ways.
The sound is great, the artwork is pleasing, and it's 100% free. It's one of the best games I've ever played on the App Store hands down.

This game is incredibly fun and has a zen like relaxing underwater theme, and the music compliments it beautifully! It literally has infinite replay-ability because it's pong, with enemies, power ups, and now mid stage saving! Hoorah!!
love this game. only time i've ever been moved to write an email to a game developer to ask about an update. 10/10

Beautiful gameplay, extremely polished, Pong packed with innovation, leveling up to unlock paddles, *each* with different powers. This is unlike other titles where you unlock 30 plus items and they all function the same. All of the paddles have their advantages and disadvantages. As you progress you unlock superior paddles.
If you enjoy premium action and breakout games with a twist, stop reading and buy this.

The game is awesome and is a really neat concept I like it and it was worth the 3 bucks. The developers actually have made it even better now you can restart a lvl instead of dying and having to restart.

title.label: Great game, love the pay once and play model

content.label:
I LOVE games in which you pay once and then just play. In app purchases and play limits for "freemium" games are annoying. 

The game itself is fun to look at. It has a clever tongue-in-cheek sci-fi feel. Music is cool. Controls are easy to use. Would recommend.
Artsy pong on primordial psychedelic aesthetics = a pretty great time I must say.
Really well made game, more levels/ modes please!
Awesome graphics,  awesome reward system,  and very addictive.  I finally got past the level 2-4 boss, and then died at level 3-2.  I will not play again until I can save my game progress.  üò∂
Best game period and the Sumerian Art Deco is the best
It's like Pong by yourself! With crustaceans and stars and cuneiform! What's not to like? And satisfying sound design. Nice job, developers!

title.label: Kudos but the depth is lacking

content.label: I admire the developer for not including in app purchases.  The gameplay is simple and challenging. That in itself is not a bad thing, but in this game you restart from the beginning each time you die. This forces you to play the exact same levels over and over ad nauseum. I would much prefer a level progression system or at least random level generation. Also the boss style battle on level 2-4 is simply cruel. I'm half inclined to believe the boss just retreats of the edge of the screen and kills you every time you have it down to 1 hp. Even with a shield blocking the top, this guy breaks through and kills you. Another serious annoyance is the flash effect when your ball hits an enemy.  This flash causes you to lose track of your ball. If it's anywhere near the edge you're going to lose it. This game's redeeming quality is that you feel some sort of progression in unlocking paddles. But it does little in alleviating the frustration that comes with all the other drawbacks. I know of quite a few games that i will play much more, despite their IAP, simply because they have a richer, deeper, and more replayable format.
A quiet and relaxing game...graphically stimulating.
I love the visuals and gamely

title.label: Not as fun as I thought

content.label: I saw the good reviews from this and thought it was good so I tried it but when I played it it was a bigger disappointment to me it was ok but not that fun can I please have my money back
Maybe bro

I love this amped up version of old school Pong.
My kids love it too.

An addicting remixed pong with great sounds, great music, awesome gameplay, and smooth and easy controls anyone can jump into immediately. No complications and no defined skills to learn other than aiming the ball a specific direction. Although the game predictably gets more difficult the farther you go, I haven't seen crisp gameplay like this in a long time. Already unlocked all of the paddles and trying to beat my best stage at 4-3!

This game has a great atmosphere but it doesn't take itself too seriously. I've only played the first few levels and then I got a screen asking me to rate it. I'll continue playing and if I feel I need to change my review, I'll come back.

So far, so good.
Would be infinitely better if it saved your progress and let you keep working up.  Starting over and over is boring.

Well made and worth the money. 

Update: Still enjoy the game. Only improvement I could think of would be the option to start at the beginning of stages already unlocked instead of playing from the very beginning every time. The beginning stages can eventually become too easy and boring. There would still be an incentive for players to start from the beginning to earn more coins for upgrades.
Fun and challenging. And I love that there are no in app purchases. Keep it up!!
Visually stunning. Great graphics. Good mechanics.
I love this game, but it doesn't save your progress...   I had 131 coins when I left the game and when I play again, I have none.   Boo.   Fix this please.

This game was actually pretty boring to me. It's like pong but you control both paddles and you have to aim the projectile at creatures that are attempting to make their way to the top of the screen... same ole game, different package.
Could be longer
Well worth three dollars.  Pong made beautiful and interesting.  Strangely relaxing considering it is like an old school arcade game.  Nice music, wonderfully rendered.  Nice work.
Addicting and challenging gameplay make this game well worth the price of admission.
A better Pong! Who would have thought...

title.label: Yea, 'tis a heady undersea brew of a game

content.label: Just give it a go. I'm still getting my sea legs, but it's good fun with a nice sense of play.
